body.p:
Licking Station
Ky
Aug 29th/61
To his Excellency
B Magoffin
Gov Com Kenty

This petitioner Wm Allen states that about the 11th July 1861. being exasperated by a peremptory decision to leave the store house of one Elijah Patrick, who had employed James McGuire clerk (said demand being made by sd McGuire) his did on the date "above mentioned informed sd McGuire" he would leave when he got ready", whereupon said McGuire did without reasonable cause strike said petitioner thereby disabling said Allen in the use of his left shoulder and wherefore a jury of twelve men summoned by Thos Whitaker D,, S,, for S Magoffin Co, did on the
10th day of Aug 1861 fine this petitioner the sum of seventeen dollars and fifty cents -- exclusive of cost which in all amounted to thirty dollars, Now therefore I, ^the^ said Wm Allen do petition the Gov of Comwlh of Kentucky that the unjust fine imposed by the verdict of said jury, be remitted -- it having been imposed by a jury whose political sentences had been wrought to such a pitch, that they could not render an impartial verdict.
We the undersigned certify that the statements made in the above petition are true to the best of our information --

Wm L Salyer
A S Martin --
Samuel Salyers
John Salyers
Dial S. Williams
Joseph Gahart
